page.title: 11CATTLE FARMING - PARK FARM
page.content: The grassland at Park Farm comprises 20% of total farm area.It carries approx 420 head of Freisian cattle,260 milking cows in two herds,160 heifer replacements for both herds.Their winter housing is in open yards,on straw bedding,feeding hay and grass silage.Winter for cows begins October ends April.Cows are milked twice daily,6am and again 3pm.Each cow averages per lactation 5600 litres on 1.3 tonnes of cereal concentrate which is parlour fed.During Spring and Summer cows graze sub-devided fields of grass.Replacement heifers calve at 2.5 to 3 years to a Hereford bull.They then enter the herd and calves are sold at market or reared for beef.
